oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of mechanical soil treatment in blueberry orchards
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Benduhn, Bastian
Maxin, Peter
Pfeiffer, Barbara
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From June 2004 onwards a trial was conducted on a blueberry farm in the LÃ¼neburg Heath, Northern Germany, in which methods of mechanical soil cultivation were compared with mulching. The aim was to determine how far the mechanical methods and equipment established for soil management in viniculture and pomiculture can be adapted to blueberry cultivation, and can be improved. The results showed a clear advantage of the methods based on mulch technology in the shape of increased yields. Whilst the mechanical treatments provided acceptable weed control, they cannot be recommended for routine use at present because of strong yield reductions associated with damage to the shallow root system of highbush blueberry shrubs.
